non_compliant.legal provisions: The right to withdraw consent; Right to lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority
non_compliant.amend: It is generally not permissible under the GDPR to use contractual clauses to limit an individual's rights under the regulation.  Consider revising the  'Waiver' clause to clarify that it does not affect data subjects' rights to withdraw consent or lodge complaints with supervisory authorities.

non_compliant.section: The failure of Faraday to exercise or enforce any right or provision of the T&Cs shall not constitute a waiver of such right or provision.
non_compliant.legal provisions: The right to withdraw consent; Right to lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority
non_compliant.amend: This section could be interpreted as limiting a data subject's rights under GDPR.  Clarify that this provision does not waive data subjects' rights to withdraw consent or lodge complaints with supervisory authorities.

non_compliant.section: If any provision of the T&Cs is found by a court of competent jurisdiction to be invalid, the parties nevertheless agree that the court should endeavor to give effect to the parties' intentions as reflected in the provision, and the other provisions of the T&Cs remain in full force and effect.
non_compliant.amend: While this clause is standard, ensure that if any provision is deemed invalid, the remaining provisions still comply with GDPR principles such as lawfulness, fairness, transparency, purpose limitation, data minimization, accuracy, storage limitations, integrity and confidentiality, and accountability.
